content:
• Friday, February 10, 2017
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics up 7.3%, headed to SmallCap 600

    • Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN) is up 7.3% in after-hours trade on news that it's headed into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It will replace Inteliquent (NASDAQ:IQNT) in that index, as private-equity firm GTCR's $23/share buyout of the company wrapped up today.
    • Personalized-medicine firm Myriad will be added to the Biotechnology sub-industry index after the close Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley CFO Sierks to depart

    • Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) -2.8% AH after disclosing that CFO Kevin Sierks will leave the company, effective March 31.
    • Sierks became VRA's fulltime CFO in 2014 after serving a year as interim CFO; before joining VRA in 2011, he was VP and controller at Biomet and director of accounting at Boston Scientific.
    • VP of Financial Planning and Analysis John Enwright will become interim CFO; he joined VRA in 2014 after holding various financial positions of increasing responsibility at Tiffany for 15 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • WCIC

    Lennar closes $643M deal for WCI Communities

    • Lennar (LEN +3.6%) has closed on its acquisition of WCI Communities (NYSE:WCIC) at an equity value of $643M.
    • It's paying all cash consideration, $23.50/share for WCI common stock held before the merger became effective. The two made the deal at an enterprise value for WCI of $809M.
    • As part of the deal, Lennar becomes a co-issuer on WCI's 6.875% senior notes due 2021, of which $250M are outstanding.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: MYGN +6.9%. GLAD +3.3%. OSUR +1.7%. PDS +1.6%. NCR +1.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: VRA -2.9%. GPS -2.6%. SHLD -2.6%. RIO -2.4%. CARA -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 9 Comments
  • TWLO

    Twilio unlocks final pool of IPO-restrained shares

    • Approximately 31M of 36M Twilio shares had remained restricted among insiders as of January 19 in a follow-on associated lockup due to a corporate trading blackout related to earnings timing. This period followed initial IPO lockup expiry (31M shares) in December 2016.
    • As of today's market open, the 31M shares previously subject to blackout regulation have gone unlocked, making all 67M originally repressed shares available to be sold.
    • Twilio (NYSE:TWLO) today $31.96, -2.59% (volume 9.47M over 4.53M average).
    • Earlier this week (February 7, 2017): Twilio +2.55%; Q4 2016 results, revenue forecasts over expectations
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 64 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: URA +8.9%. GDXJ +6.5%. GAZ +4.1%. FXI +3.8%. GDX +3.2%.
    • Top losers: VXX -3.2%. FXE -1.4%. EWY -1.3%. REMX -1.3%. FCG -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • MX

    MagnaChip Semiconductor -9.15%; Needham & Company considers oversold, reiterates Buy

    • Analyst Rajvindra Gill spotlights MagnaChip Semiconductor's (NYSE:MX) Q4 2016 and future outlook as encouraging amid an ongoing turnaround narrative, while attributing today's sell-off to management commentary indicating lower AMOLED revenue for H1 2017, prior to an expected ramp in H2 2017. Remains, however, confident in the company's AMOLED design win pipeline as well as positive on MagnaChip Semiconductor's continued prioritization of improvement in gross margin, cash flow and profitability.
    • Reissues $10 price target (current price $7.45).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • KNL

    Knoll EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • Knoll (NYSE:KNL): Q4 EPS of $0.44 in-line.
    • Revenue of $292.9M (-4.2% Y/Y) misses by $20.65M.
    • Shares +2.73%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Brazil court suspends $5.2B sale of Petrobras gas pipeline unit

    • A Brazilian federal court has suspended Petrobras' (PBR +2.7%) $5.2B sale of the Nova Transportadora do Sudesteon natural gas pipeline unit to a group of investors led by Brookfield Asset Management (BAM -0.4%).
    • The court granted the injunction on grounds that the sale was not sufficiently publicized to foster competition.
    • Nova Transportadora supplies gas to Brazil’s most populated and industrialized states of Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 11 Comments
  • SKX

    Skechers soars 20% on strong sales numbers

    • The company topped revenue estimates in Q4, and Q1 revenue guidance was also stronger-than-expected ($1.05B-$1.075B vs. Street at $1.04B).
    • But what about profits, asks Wedbush's Christopher Svezia, reiterating his Neutral rating and $25 price target (vs. current $27.87).
    • The Q4 bottom line of $0.04 missed estimates by a nickel, and Q1 EPS guidance of $0.50-$0.55 is shy of the Street at $0.66.
    • For now, sales growth isn't translating into profits and the "inflection continues to move further out, increasing risk should growth not materialize," he says.
    • Skechers earnings center, including conference call transcript
    • SKX +19.6%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 5 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: SWIR +29%. INFN +27%. CTRL +20%. ATVI +17%. CPSI +15%.
    • Losers: ECOM -24%. IPAS -19%. UBNT -16%. OTC:FNCX -14%. APDN -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport says it has no new Indonesia export permit

    • Freeport McMoRan (FCX +2.9%) says it has not yet reached an agreement with Indonesia's government on a new permit for its Grasberg mine, and copper concentrate exports remain restricted.
    • The government reportedly had issued a new mining permit to FCX after halting shipments of copper concentrate exports on Jan. 12.
    • Nevertheless, FCX is sharply higher along with the price of copper after BHP Billiton declared force majeure on shipments from its Escondida mine amid a workers strike.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 24 Comments
  • P

    Pandora +2.5% with analysts positive despite profit challenges

    • Following postmarket declines after an earnings report that featured dim forward guidance, Pandora Media (NYSE:P) is up 2.5% with analysts largely confident about prospects.
    • B. Riley reiterated its Buy rating and holds a $17 price target, implying 31% upside. And RBC Capital Markets has boosted its price target to $16.
    • Wedbush stuck with its Outperform rating and $15 price target even while acknowledging it's unlikely the company will become profitable this year.
    • “Pandora could surpass our 2017 revenue estimates, but we believe overall profitability in 2017 is less likely,” says Michael Pachter.
    • But: “We believe that Pandora can convert at least 1M Pandora Plus subscribers to on-demand and can attract 1–2M net new U.S. on-demand subscribers in 2017, while up-selling ad-supported customers to its Pandora Plus service."
    • Cowen & Co., meanwhile, lowered its price target on shares, to $9 -- 30% downside from current price.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 3 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: WRN +17%. GLF +12%. SDRL +11%. NE +12%. TGA +11%.
    • Losers: FET -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • VALE

    Iron ore prices jump to 29-month high on surging China imports

    • Iron ore prices rose today to the highest in nearly two and a half years after data from China showed surging iron ore imports.
    • Platts’ IODEX prices for 62% iron ore fines delivered to China surged 3% to $86.60/metric ton, the highest level since September 2014, after the Chinese government said January iron ore imports rose to 92M metric tons, up 11.9% Y/Y and 3.4% from the previous month.
    • “The continued strong iron ore import totals represent to us continued strength in China’s steel sector, which we expect to continue” to H2 2017, Barclays says.
    • The world's top three iron ore producers are higher: VALE +5%, RIO +5.2%, BHP +2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 12 Comments
  • ESIO

    Electro Scientific Industries higher 6.3% on corporate restructuring plans

    • ESIO +6.3% expects to reduce its cost structure by $10 to $12M on an annualized basis and lower its non-GAAP EBITDA breakeven point to approx. $35M of quarterly revenue once the corporate restructuring actions are fully implemented.
    • The company expects pre-tax charges of $6.5 to $8.5M, of which aprox.$5M is expected to be recorded in the 4Q17.
    • The corporate actions are expected to be largely completed by the end of June 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • EARN

    Ellington Residential +5.5% after strong Q4 performance

    • Q4 core earnings of $4.9M or $0.54 per share vs. $2.9M and $0.32 in Q3. Dividend is $0.40. Excluding catch-up premium amortization adjustment, core EPS of $0.47 vs. $0.48 in Q3.
    • End-of-Q4 book value per share of $15.52 slips from $15.70 three months earlier. After today's big gain, shares are trading at a 10% discount to book.
    • Economic return for quarter $0.22, or 5.6% annualized - a seemingly modest number, but compared to sizable negative returns at other mREITs, it may qualify as a blowout.
    • Net interest margin of 1.89% up from 1.30% in Q3; excluding catch-up premium amortization adjustment of 1.69% down eight basis points from Q3.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Previously: Ellington Residential Mortgage REIT beats by $0.02 (Feb. 10)
    • EARN +5.5% to $13.92.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:10 PM

    • Gainers: CBG +9%. BSBR +6%. EARN +6%.
    • Losers: SIEB -10%. MBTF -6%. TBBK -5%. FXCM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto recruits three energy executives to board

    • Rio Tinto (RIO +5.2%) says it appointed three former senior managers from the energy industry to its board as non-executive directors, including departing Royal Dutch Shell CFO Simon Henry.
    • Henry, who is stepping down as CFO at Shell after seven years on March 9, will join Rio on July 1, while former Centrica CEO Sam Laidlaw and ex-Sasol CEO David Constable will begin their new posts immediately.
    • The appointments, which will add significant energy industry expertise to Rio's board, are noteworthy in light of previous comments by CEO Jean-Sebastien Jacques that he was not interested in expanding Rio into the oil and gas industry.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • BHP

    BHP's Escondida copper mine declares force majeure

    • BHP Billiton (BHP +2.1%) declares force majeure on shipments from its Escondida mine in Chile, as a two-day-old workers' strike brings production to a standstill.
    • LME copper prices shot up 4.5% to $6,083/metric ton, the highest since June 2015, and mining stocks are rallying: FCX +3.9%, RIO +4.9%, VALE +4.6%.
    • The miners union says it is preparing for a long strike, as it builds a workers’ camp outside the mine that’s designed to last at least two months.
    • ETFs: JJC, CPER, CUPM
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SHLD +29%. SWIR +29%. INFN +27%. IMMU +27%. PLSE +23%. OCUL +20%. CTRL +20%. BIOC +20%. SKX +19%. QUOT +18%.
    • Losers: ECOM -24%. TCON -22%. IPAS -19%. EGLE -17%. ONVO -15%. SMSI -14%. APDN -14%. YELP -14%. UBNT -14%. MX -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • NE

    Noble Corp. +12% on smaller than expected Q4 loss, lifting drillers

    • Noble Corp. (NE +12.7%) surges after reporting a narrower than expected Q4 loss and stronger than expected revenues of $410M, even though sales came in 52% below year-ago levels and analysts remain generally neutral on the stock.
    • NE says its $1B-plus revenue base, along with further reductions in contract drilling costs and capital spending, should result in another year of positive free cash flow.
    • Stephens reiterates an Equal Weight rating and $7 price target on the stock, saying NE has proven its ability to successfully manage its cost structure, execute operationally and generate cash flow (~$105M in Q4) despite difficult market conditions.
    • Raymond James reiterates its Market Perform rating, as NE’s commitment to cost rationalization largely drove the better than expected Q4 results, with contract drilling expenses of $177M coming in below the middle of NE’s $190M-$205M guidance range.
    • Offshore drillers are broadly higher: RIG +2.1%, ATW +3%, RDC +3.1%, ESV +6.9%, DO +4.6%, SDRL +13.1%, PACD +5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 8 Comments
  • JBLU

    JetBlue Airways January traffic up 8.6%

    • JetBlue (JBLU -1.3%) reports revenue passenger miles rose 8.6% in January to 3.863B.
    • Capacity increased 7.7% Y/Y to 4.637B available seat miles.
    • January load factor +70 bps to 83.3%.
    • Preliminary revenue per available seat mile declined ~8.5% during the month.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 7 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SKX +20%. COLM +11%. VUZI +7%. WATT +6%. CMT +5%.
    • Losers: NAKD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • CBRE

    CBRE Group +9% after big earnings beat

    • Q4 adjusted net income of $314.7M up 16% Y/Y; adjusted EPS of $0.93 up 15%. Full-year adjusted EPS up 12% to $2.30.
    • Stripping out forex impact, adjusted EPS rose 19% Y/Y in Q4.
    • Q4 adjusted EBITDA of $568.5M up 10% Y/Y; adjusted EBITDA margin on fee revenue of 21.4%.
    • Americas revenue (largest segment) up 6% in Q4; Asia-Pacific revenue (fastest growing) up 22%, or 19% in local currency. EMEA revenue rose 6%, but fell 3% in U.S. dollars thanks mostly to the decline in the pound. U.K. revenue rose 8% in pounds amid the post-Brexit vote fallout.
    • 2017 adjusted EPS is guided to $2.35-$2.45 per share (the midpoint would be 4.3% growth over 2016). This includes expectations for a $0.06 per share hit from forex movements.
    • Earnings call presentation slides
    • Previously: CB Richard beats by $0.13, misses on revenue (Feb. 10)
    • CBG +9%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • NLSN

    Nielsen adds public-policy vet Rawlinson to board

    • Nielsen (NLSN +2.3%) has added U.S. executive-branch veteran David Rawlinson to its board.
    • Rawlinson served in an economic policy role with both the Bush and Obama Administrations. He's currently president of Online Business for W.W. Grainger.
    • Since 2014, he's served on the board for MonotaRO, Grainger's publicly traded online business in Japan. He'll serve on the audit committee at Nielsen.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • TWTR

    Goldman Sachs reaffirms Twitter at Buy

    • With sentiment broadly turning lower on Twitter following its reporting of 1% revenue growth in Q4 2016 and issuance of negatively implied outlook, analyst Heath Terry maintains confidence, though reduces target from $22 to $20.
    • Notes: "We continue to see significant value in Twitter’s user base, engagement, data and content. With TWTR trading at 19.6X 2017E EV/EBITDA vs. the sector at 13X, modestly accelerating user engagement, potential for margin recovery post restructuring, and M&A optionality we see the risk/reward as favorable and remain Buy rated."
    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) $15.68, -4.45%.
    • Previously (February 9, 2017): Twitter downgraded to Underperform at Cowen and Company, Raymond James
    • Previously (February 9, 2017): Twitter target reduced to $10 at Morgan Stanley
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 46 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia reiterated at Hold at Stifel

    • Notable amid several confident reiterations and target raises to levels $130+ (Canaccord Genuity, UBS, Jefferies, RBC Capital Markets, Mizuho Securities) and bullish commentary elsewhere (Needham & Company, Instinet) following Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) positive Q4 2017 and outlook, Stifel analyst Kevin Cassidy similarly commends the quarter, though maintains position on valuation.
    • Increases target from $76 to $90 (current price $114.38, -1.72%).
    • Previously (February 9, 2017): Nvidia -2.05%; Q4 2017, revenue outlook over estimates
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 18 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti -14.8%; Credit Suisse cuts to Underperform

    • Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT) is 14.8% lower and hitting its lowest point since October following fiscal Q2 earnings where it missed profits as gross margins were pressed by its product mix and expedited holiday 2016 shipping costs.
    • Credit Suisse has cut the shares to Underperform, noting shares look pricey compared to peers and that margins may be peaking and face further pressure as Ubiquiti invests more in research and development.
    • Analyst Kulbinder Garcha is also pointing to other issues: The company lacks a CFO and changed auditors last year, raising control concerns, and it's subject to the recent lawsuit by Synopsys claiming Ubiquiti used its software thousands of times with counterfeit keys rather than paying for a license.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 106 Comments

  • Big jobs numbers out of Canada; loonie gains

    • Canada added 48K jobs in January, blowing away estimates for just 10K. The unemployment rate ticked down to 6.8% vs. expectations for a flat read at 6.9%.
    • After a rough 2015 and most of 2016, job growth up north has been strong for five of the last six months.
    • Glass half-empty types will note the continuing surge in part-time work - over the last year, part-time positions have increased by 190K, while full-time has fallen by 86K.
    • "This will keep alive concerns that Canada’s economy is not generating the 'right' types of jobs," says RBC's Dawn Desjardins.
    • The loonie (NYSEARCA:FXC) is higher by 0.5% vs. the greenback and buying $0.7647. Stocks (NYSEARCA:EWC) in Toronto are up 0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 4 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: GBSN +29%. PLSE +27%. IMMU +27%. OCUL +18%. BIOC +17%.
    • Losers: TCON -19%. ONVO -14%. PDEX -11%. MYOS -10%. BTX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision Blizzard +16.1% to new highs after record quarter

    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) is up 16.1% to all-time highs after a record Q4 report where the company beat expectations and added a new $1B buyback program along with a higher dividend.
    • Guidance for the coming year is probably conservative, analysts suggest.
    • Jefferies analyst Tim O'Shea has one of the most bullish price targets at $55, implying another 19% upside. The company beat despite sales declines at its cash cow Call of Duty franchise; more evidence that initial sell-in isn't as important as before, he says.
    • The company has tough 2017 comps in Blizzard, says UBS analyst Eric Sheridan, but a positive ramp is coming with a new Destiny in September, and a return to form for Call of Duty could provide second-half growth as well. He's boosted his price target to $48 from $45.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 9 Comments
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal +5% as Q4 swings to profit; sees higher demand in U.S., Brazil

    • ArcelorMittal (MT +5.2%) is ~5% higher after reporting net Q4 earnings of $403M helped by improved costs, compared with a $6.69B loss in the year-ago quarter, and expressing optimism about 2017 and the potential impact of Pres. Trump's proposals on the company.
    • CEO Lakshmi Mittal says Trump's promises to invest in U.S. infrastructure and manufacturing are "good for us" as well as the steel industry at large, and thinks Trump could promote strong trade actions against a glut of Chinese steel on the global market.
    • MT says year-end net debt stood at $11.1B, down from $15.7B at the end of 2015 and now at the lowest since the creation of the company a decade ago.
    • MT says it expects to increase 2017 capex to $2.9B from $2.4B last year due to recovering steel markets; it sees apparent steel consumption - which takes into account inventory changes - for the market to rise by up to 4% in the U.S. and in Brazil in 2017 after declines last year, with Chinese declining by as much as 1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • CERN

    Cerner Q4 top line up 7%; earnings down 10%; cash flow ops down 6%; shares ease 4% on conservative EPS guidance

    • Cerner (CERN -4.1%) Q4 results ($M): Total Revenues: 1,257.8 (+7.0%); System Sales: 352.3 (-7.8%); Support, Maintenance & Services: 880.5 (+13.5%).
    • Net Income: 149.7 (-9.9%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 206.2 (-2.9%); EPS: 0.44 (-8.3%); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.61 (unch); CF Ops: 333.2 (-5.6%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $5.1B - 5.3B; Non-GAAP EPS: $2.44 - 2.56 (consensus is $2.56).
    • Q1 Guidance: Revenues: $1.200B - 1.275B; Non-GAAP EPS: $0.57 - 0.59; New business bookings: $1.125B - 1.275B.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • PLSE

    Former Pharmacyclics execs take 17% stake in Pulse Bio; shares up 33%

    • Ultra-thinly traded Pulse Biosciences (PLSE +32.5%) jumps out of the blocks on increased volume, albeit on turnover of only 19K shares, in response to its announcement that the former CEO and COO of Pharmacyclics, Bob Duggan and Maky Zanganeh, have taken a 17.1% stake in the company. Mr. Duggan owns ~2.1M shares while new board member Zangeneh owns ~279K shares.
    • Development-stage Pulse's technology platform is called Nano-Pulse Stimulation (NPS). The company says NPS has potential as a cancer treatment. When NPS is applied directly to tissue it creates a transient opening of small pores in cell and organelle membranes that triggers a signaling cascade within a tumor that leads to cell death.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • GBSN

    Great Basin initiates restructuring plan, 50 jobs cut, $36M convertible debt redeemed

    • With the aim of reducing its cash consumption and goosing growth, Great Basin Scientific (NASDAQ:GBSN) launches a restructuring plan that it says will streamline certain manufacturing and administrative processes. The move involves the elimination of 50 positions nationwide. Annual cash burn should be reduced $10M - 12M.
    • Concurrently, the company has agreed to redeem $35.6M of its outstanding 2016 Notes with cash from its restricted accounts. Afterward, the aggregate principal amount of the Notes outstanding will be $36.3M (from $71.8M).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 10 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: SHLD +40%. INFN +19%. BIOL +18%. CTRL +16%. BIOC +14%. ATVI +12%. SKX +12%. ICPT +11%. WRN +10%. SWIR +10%. IMMU +8%. FCX +7%. OCUL +6%. NE +6%. SDRL +5%.
    • Losers: TCON -22%. ONVO -16%. YELP -12%. IPCI -10%. EGLE -10%. BTX -9%. UBNT -7%. SGEN -6%. LIVE -5%. CERN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • BTX

    BioTime prices equity offering; shares ease 7% premarket

    • BioTime (NYSEMKT:BTX) slumps 7% premarket on increased volume in response to the pricing of its public offering of 6,481,482 shares of common stock at $2.70. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 972,222 shares. Closing date is February 15. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $3.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural prices upsized offering at $10.75, but Macquarie out positive

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) -4.6% premarket after upsizing its public offering by 5M shares and pricing 55M shares at $10.75 each.
    • Macquarie analysts praise the offering, saying it removes the debt burden, positions the company to grow, and should advance the timetable for making an announcement to enter the DRI market to 2017.
    • "If management's guidance proves to be accurate, we believe the shares may be worth as much as $20," Macquarie adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 25 Comments
  • INFN

    Infinera target increased at Needham & Company, upgraded to Buy at Instinet

    • Following Infinera's Q4 2016 reporting (earnings call transcript), analyst Alex Henderson (Needham & Company) reiterates at Strong Buy, noting firm was too early in calling the rating originally, though observes "that the company has troughed, estimates have bottomed out and that INFN is poised to rebound results," and considers it at this point more suitable. Target from $12.50 prior.
    • Analyst Keffrey Kvaal (Instinet): "1Q guidance was in line with to below consensus estimates—disappointing, given that it was INFN’s fourth straight guide down and 4Q ended up fine. However, strengthening in Europe/webscale and a solidifying product roadmap lend visibility to sequential growth through 2017." Raises target from $8 to $15, rating from Neutral.
    • Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) $10.80, +14.89% pre-market.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 6 Comments
  • ICPT

    Shortened timeline for Intercept's late-stage study of OBA in NASH stokes investors, shares up 11% premarket

    • In an update to investors, Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) announces that it has changed the protocol, based on discussion with the FDA, in its Phase 3 REGENERATE study that should accelerate its completion and enhance the prospects for a positive outcome.
    • The changes include a new primary endpoint of fibrosis improvement or NASH resolution (previously both) and a reduction in target enrollment to 750 subjects from ~2,000 (to be completed mid-year).
    • Shares are up 11% premarket on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 7 Comments
  • IPCI

    IntelliPharmaCeutics reports FY16 results; shares off 10% premarket

    • IntelliPharmaCeutics (IPCI) FY16 results: Revenues: $2.2M (-46.3%); Operating Loss: ($9.9M) (-39.4%); Net Loss: ($10.1M) (-36.5%); Loss Per Share: ($0.38) (-22.6%); Quick Assets: $4.1M (+127.8%); CF Ops: ($6.3M) (-65.8%).
    • No guidance given.
    • Shares are down 10.07% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 14 Comments
  • G

    More on Genpact's Q4

    • Genpact (NYSE:G) reports revenue rose 7% on a constant currency basis in Q4.
    • Global Client revenue grew 9% to $576M (~+11% on a constant currency basis).
    • GE revenue down 10% to $106M.
    • New bookings up 3% Y/Y to $2.65B.
    • Gross margin rate improved 120 bps to 40.3%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate expanded 190 bps to 16.7%.
    • The company repurchased 4.3M shares during the quarter.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Total revenue: $2.61B to $2.68B (+2% to +4%); Global Client revenue: +4% to +7% (5% to 8% on a constant currency basis); Adjusted operating margin rate: 15.7%; Adjusted EPS: $1.53 to $1.57.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport +4% as Indonesia reportedly issues new mining permit

  • SHLDQ

    Sears soars nearly 20% on restructuring plans

    • Plans include at least $1B of annualized cost savings by reducing corporate overhead, more closely integrating Sears and Kmart operations, and improving merchandising, supply chain, and inventory management.
    • The $1B in savings include those from previously announced closings of 108 Kmarts and 42 Sears stores.
    • Proceeds from the Craftsman sale and real estate transactions, along with hoped-for improved operating performance will be used to cut debt. The target is for a reduction in debt and pension obligations of $1.5B in fiscal 2017.
    • Q4 comp sales were down 10.3%, with an 8% decline at Kmart and 12.3% at Sears Domestic. Preliminary adjusted EBITDA of negative $61M vs. negative $137M a year ago.

  • IMMU

    Immunomedics up 28% premarket on license deal with Seattle Genetics for lead product candidate IMMU-132 valued as high as $2B

    • Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) jumps 28% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that it has entered into an exclusive global licensing agreement with Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN) for lead product product candidate IMMU-132 (sacituzumab govitecan).
    • SGEN will be responsible for initiating the Phase 3 study of IMMU-132 in triple-negative breast cancer and submitting the marketing application to the FDA. Other indications that will be pursued include urothelial cancer, small-cell lung cancer and non-small cell lung cancer.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, IMMU will receive an upfront payment of $250M, an additional $50M related to rights outside of the U.S., Canada and EU, up to $1.7B in milestones and tiered double-digit royalties on net sales. IMMU retains the right to co-promote IMMU-132 in the U.S. subject to conditions.
    • SGEN has also made an equity investment in IMMU via the purchase of 3M common shares at $4.90. The investment includes a three-year warrant to purchase 8,655,804 common shares at the same price.
    • IMMU-132 is an antibody-drug conjugate consisting of an monoclonal antibody that binds to a protein found on the surface of many types of cancer cells called TROP-2. Specifically binding to the cancer cell enables the precise delivery of the cytotoxic payload, SN-38 (govitecan), the active metabolite of the chemo agent irinotecan. Its value proposition is the ability to deliver the drug over repeated cycles of therapy since govitecan is less toxic than other chemotherapies.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:00 am ET to discuss the deal.
    • SGEN is down 6% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 4 Comments

  • TCON

    TRACON Pharma's lead product candidate flunks mid-stage study in brain cancer

    • Thinly traded nano cap TRACON Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TCON) is poised for an ugly day today on the heels of its announcement of results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate TRC105 in recurrent glioblastoma (GBM).
    • The study evaluated the effect on three-month progression-free survival (PFS) of TRC105 combined with Roche's Avastin (bevacizumab) compared to the expected value of 3.45 months for Avastin alone. Top-line results showed that the addition of TRC105 failed to significantly improve PFS, although there was a numerical increase in overall survival.
    • Detailed results will be presented at an oncology conference (ASCO) later this year.
    • TRC105 (carotuximab) is a novel clinical-stage antibody to endoglin, a protein overexpressed on proliferating endothelial cells that is essential for angiogenesis. It has Orphan Drug status for the treatment of soft tissue sarcoma and Fast Track status for kidney cancer.
    • Update: Shares are down 20% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 AM
